[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/error.rs] [Enum: AptosErrorCode::InvalidTransactionUpdate] [Transaction Replacement Attack] Can InvalidTransactionUpdate (401) be weaponized to prevent legitimate transaction updates, causing DoS for specific accounts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/error.rs] [Enum: AptosErrorCode::SequenceNumberTooOld] [Nonce Manipulation] Can an attacker force SequenceNumberTooOld (402) errors to lock accounts out of submitting transactions by manipulating mempool state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/error.rs] [Enum: AptosErrorCode::VmError] [VM Error Masking] Does VmError (403) properly preserve critical security information from the VM, or can it hide consensus-breaking bugs behind a generic error code? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/error.rs] [Enum: AptosErrorCode::RejectedByFilter] [Filter Bypass] Can attackers probe the RejectedByFilter (404) response to reverse-engineer transaction filters and craft bypasses for security controls? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/error.rs] [Enum: AptosErrorCode::HealthCheckFailed] [Health Check Oracle] Can HealthCheckFailed (500) responses be used to time validator state changes and coordinate attacks during vulnerable periods? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/error.rs] [Enum: AptosErrorCode::MempoolIsFull] [Mempool DoS] Can an attacker exploit MempoolIsFull (501) by filling the mempool with low-value transactions to prevent high-priority transactions from validators or governance? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/error.rs] [Enum: AptosErrorCode::InternalError] [Error Information Disclosure] Does InternalError (600) leak stack traces, file paths, or internal state that could help attackers map system internals? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/error.rs] [Enum: AptosErrorCode::WebFrameworkError] [Framework Exploit] Can WebFrameworkError (601) be triggered to expose vulnerabilities in the underlying Poem framework, potentially leading to RCE? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/error.rs] [Enum: AptosErrorCode::BcsNotSupported] [Protocol Downgrade] Can BcsNotSupported (602) be exploited to force clients into using less secure JSON serialization instead of BCS, enabling attack vectors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/error.rs] [Enum: AptosErrorCode::ApiDisabled] [API Enumeration] Can ApiDisabled (603) responses be used to map which API endpoints are enabled/disabled across different validators, identifying configuration weaknesses? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/error.rs] [Enum: AptosErrorCode] [Repr Safety] Does #[repr(u32)] on line 59 prevent all possible undefined behavior, or can unsafe code elsewhere cast invalid u32 values to AptosErrorCode variants? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/error.rs] [Enum: AptosErrorCode] [Enum Layout] Are there any gaps in the error code numbering (e.g., 110-199, 202-299) that could be exploited if new error codes are added without proper review? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/error.rs] [Derive: Serialize] [Serialization Bomb] Can the Serialize derive on AptosError be exploited to create serialization bombs that expand exponentially when deserialized, causing memory exhaustion? (Medium)
